meanings.definition: A discharge or release from a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The quittances provided relief from their financial burdens.
meanings.sent2: She received quittances after paying off her loan.
meanings.sent3: The magical quittances made all debts disappear instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a quittance from worry and stress.
meanings.sent5: The quittances were like keys unlocking their freedom from debt.

meanings.definition: To settle or repay a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: They quittanced their debts by working hard.
meanings.sent2: He promised to quittance the loan by the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel quittanced its nut debt by collecting extra acorns.
meanings.sent4: She quittanced her promises with sincerity and dedication.
meanings.sent5: Quittancing the debt felt like lifting a heavy weight off his shoulders.

meanings.definition: A document or receipt acknowledging payment or settlement.
meanings.sent1: She kept all her quittances in a safe box.
meanings.sent2: The quittances were neatly organized in a folder.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the quittance, thinking it was a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The quittance was a golden ticket to financial freedom.
meanings.sent5: The quittance bore the stamp of finality on their debt repayment.
